comment.author: 11418107@N02
comment._content: Margaret Wycherly: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Margaret_Wycherly Vira Boarman (or Boardman) Whitehouse (1875-1957): en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vira_Boarman_Whitehouse Here she is elsewhere in the LOC uploads: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/4669375444/] [http://www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/4647772300/] [http://www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/4787373518/]

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: Should be Mrs. N. de R. Whitehouse.  She was married to James Norman de Rapelye Whitehouse (1858–1949)

comment.author: 76016463@N00
comment._content: This is during the July 5, 1915 Women's Suffrage activities. Mrs. Norman de R. Whitehouse was chairman of the Empire State Campaign Committee, which arranged the events, and also Grand Marshal of the parade after the activities at Bedloe's (Liberty) Island. The New York Times account of the day says the group going to Bedloe's (Liberty) Island was taken there aboard the yacht Tourist. I think that is where this photo was taken. query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=F60711FB3B5C13738...
